title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 21.42 - Adjusted Class I differentials
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 21.42 - Adjusted Class I differentials

State Regulations
(a) The Class I differential adjusted for location to be used in section
21.40
(b) and (c)
of this Part shall be as follows: County in New York

Differential

Allegany
2.30

Cattaraugus
2.10

Cayuga
2.30

Chautauqua
2.10

Erie
2.20

Genesee
2.20

Livingston
2.30

Monroe
2.30

Niagara
2.20

Ontario
2.30

Orleans
2.20

Seneca
2.30

Steuben
2.30

Wayne
2.30

Wyoming
2.20

Yates
2.30
(b) If the location of a plant is not in one
of the counties listed in section
21.42
(a) of this

Part, the Class I differential for that location is as specified in section
1000.52 of the General provisions of Federal Marketing Orders, which appears at
64 FR
70868
-
70912
(December 17, 1999) as amended by 64 FR
73386
-
73387
(December
30, 1999), copies of which are available for public inspection at the Division
of Dairy Industry and Producer Security, Department of Agriculture and Markets, One Winners Circle, Albany, NY 12235. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
21.42

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
